name: tida.angle
comment:
Module for working with corners. While you can work with different types of angles.

	Authors: TodNaz
	License: MIT

members.comment:
Maximum angle value.

	Params:
		Type = Type angle.

	Example:
	---
	auto maxRad = max!Radians;
	---
members.name: max

members.comment:
Returns the right angle.

	Params:
		Type = Type angle.

	Example:
	---
	auto riaRad = rightAngle!Radians;
	---
members.name: rightAngle

members.comment:
Returns straight angle.

	Params:
		Type = Type angle.

	Example:
	---
	auto strRad = straight!Radians;
	---
members.name: straight

members.comment:
Translate one system of angles into another.

	Params:
		What = What to translate.
		In = What to translate.
		value = Value.

	Example:
	---
	from(Degrees,Radians)(45);
	---
members.name: from
betweenAngle
members.comment:
Finds the angle between two angel's. Accepted in any angle change systems.

	Params:
		a = First angle.
		b = Second angle.

	Returns: Angle between two angel's.

members.name: pointDirection
members.comment:
Returns the angle between two vectors in radians.

	Params:
		a = First point.
		b = Second point.

	Returns: Angle in radians.

	To convert, for example, to degrees, use the function like this:
	---
	pointDirection(...).from!(Radians,Degrees);
	---

members.name: rotate
members.originalType: @safe Vecf(Vecf vec, float angle, Vecf center)

name: tida.color
comment:
Color description module. Contains a structure for manipulating colors like RGB, there,
    and other ways to set colors. Mostly the RGB format is used, and the use of other formats
    will be converted to RGB.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: grayscale
members.comment:
Converts grayscale to the library's standard color scheme.

    Params:
        gsc = Grayscale value.

    Example:
    ---
    auto color = grayscale(128);
    ---

    Returns: RGBA

members.name: rgb
members.comment:
Creates an RGB color.

    Params:
        r = Red.
        g = Green.
        b = Blue.

    Returns: RGBA

members.name: rgba
members.comment:
Creates an RGBA color.

    Params:
        r = Red.
        g = Green.
        b = Blue.
        a = Alpha.

    Returns: RGBA

members.name: toRGB
members.comment:
Convert HSL to RGBA color.

    Params:
        str = HSL color.

    Returns: RGBA

members.name: toRGB
members.comment:
Convert HSB to RGBA color.

    Params:
        str = HSB color.

    Returns: RGBA

members.name: HEX
members.comment:
Recognizes a hex format string, converting it to RGBA representation as a `Color!ubyte` structure.

    Params:
        hex = The same performance. The following formats can be used:
              * `0xRRGGBBAA` / `0xRRGGBB`
              * `#RRGGBBAA` / `#RRGGBB`
        format = Pixel format.

    Returns: `Color!ubyte`

members.name: this
members.type: @safe (T red, T green, T blue, T alpha = T.max)

members.comment:
Converts a color to the specified type and format.

        Params:
            T = Type.
            format = Pixel format.
members.name: conv

members.comment:
Converts a color to a sequence of bytes in the specified format.

        Params:
            format = Pixel format.

        Returns: Sequence of bytes.
members.name: fromBytes

Module for describing animation.

members.comment: Whether the animation needs to be repeated.

members.name: strip
members.comment:
Creates frames from one sample picture.

		Params:
			image = The picture from where the frames will be received.
			x = The beginning of the cut by x-axis.
			y = The beginning of the cut by y-axis.
			w = Width frames.
			h = Height frames.

		Example:
		---
		anim.strip(new Image("atlas.png"),0,0,32,32);
		---

name: tida.game.collision
comment:
A module for checking the intersection of some simple shapes.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: isCollide
members.comment:
A function to check the intersection of two shapes. It does not give an intersection point,
    it gives a state that informs if there is an intersection.

    Params:
        first = First shape.
        second = Second shape.
        firstPos = Position first shape.
        secondPos = Position second shape.

    Returns:
        Gives a state indicating if there is an intersection.

    Example:
    ---
    isCollide(Shape.Rectangle(Vecf(32,32),Vecf(48,48)),
                     Shape.Line(Vecf(48,32),Vecf(32,48)));
    ---
members.originalType: @safe bool(Shape first, Shape second, Vecf firstPos = Vecf(0, 0), Vecf secondPos = Vecf(0, 0))

name: tida.game.loader
comment:
Resource loader module

    Using the loader, you can load various resources that
    will be kept in memory. They can be accessed by their
    name or path, they can also be unloaded from memory.

    Please note that it is unnecessary to reload `download` since it does
    not exist, it is implemented using the download-upload method. It will
    load the resource from the .temp folder.


    Authors: TodNaz
    Copyright:  2020, TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: loader
members.comment:
A global resource loader instance. It is through
    it that you can download and receive resources.

members.name: Loader
members.comment:
Resource loader. Loads resources, fonts and more
    and keeps it in memory.

Will load the resource, having only its path as
        input. The entire loading implementation lies with
        the resource itself. The manager will simply keep
        this resource in memory.

        Params:
            T = Data type.
            path = Path to the file.
            name = Name.

        Retunrs:
            T

        Throws: `LoadException` if the loader determines
            that the file does not exist. There may be other
            errors while loading, see their documentation,
            for example `Image`.

        Example:
        ---
        Image img = loader.load!Image("a.png");
        ---
members.name: load

members.comment:
Loads multiple resources in one fell swoop using an associated array.

        Params:
            T = Data type.
            paths = Paths and names for loading resources.

        Throws: `LoadException` if the loader determines
            that the file does not exist. There may be other
            errors while loading, see their documentation,
            for example `Image`.

        Example:
        ---
        loader.load!Image([
            "op1" : "image.png",
            "op2" : "image2.png"
        ]);
        ---
members.name: load

members.comment:
Frees the resource from memory by calling the `free`
        construct on the resource if it has unreleased pointers
        and so on, and later removes the resource from the array,
        letting the garbage collector destroy this object.

        Params:
            T = Resource class
            path = Name or Path to file resource

        Example:
        ---
        loader.free!Image("myImage");
        ---
members.name: free

members.comment:
Frees the resource from memory by calling the `free`
        construct on the resource if it has unreleased pointers
        and so on, and later removes the resource from the array,
        letting the garbage collector destroy this object.

        Params:
            T = Resource class
            obj = Resource object

        Example:
        ---
        auto myImage = loader.load!Image(...);
        loader.free(myImage);
        ---
members.name: free

members.comment:
Load a resource from the internet using `libcurl`.
        Saves to the `.temp` folder. After, downloads it.

        Params:
            url = Url resource
            altname = filename save
            name = local name

        Returns:
            `T` if all goes well and the resource is loaded.
            `null` if the resource is not found.
members.name: download
download
members.type: @trusted T(immutable string url, immutable string altname, string name = "null")

members.comment:
Returns a resource by name or path.

        Params:
            name = name resource(or path)

        Returns:
            `null` if the resource is not found.
            If found, will return a `T` of the
            appropriate size.
members.name: get
getFont
members.comment:
Will return the font by path / name and size.
        The size is required.

        Params:
            path = Path to file or name.
            size = Font size.

        Returns:
            `null` if the resource is not found.
            If found, will return a `Font` of the
            appropriate size.
members.originalType: @safe Font(immutable string path, immutable int size)

members.name: loadFont
members.comment:
Load a font of a specific size.

        Params:
            path = Path to file font
            size = The size of the font by which you can then find the
            font. It will load a font of a certain size.
            name = The short name by which the font can be found.

        Throws: `LoadException` if the file is not found. `Exception`
        if something goes wrong while loading the font.

        Returns:
            `Font`
members.originalType: @safe Font(immutable string path, immutable int size, string name = "null")

members.name: add
members.comment:
Will add a resource that was not loaded through the manager.
        Please note that it must have a path and a name.

        Params:
            res = Resource.

name: tida.graph.image
comment:
A module for describing an image. This module provides control
    of the image both with a surface and with a texture.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: this
members.comment:
Creates a surface with the specified size. Note that it is
        not yet a texture, and you dont need to draw it right away,
        to do this, convert it to a texture.

        Params:
            newWidth = Image width.
            newHeight = Image height.

members.name: this
members.comment:
Loads a surface from a file. Supported formats are described here:
        `https://code.dlang.org/packages/imageformats`

        Params:
            path = Relative or full path to the image file.

Gives a sequence of bytes that encodes a color in
        the specified color format.

        Params:
            format = Pixel format.
members.name: bytes

members.comment:
Returns a sequence of pixels in the format `0xRRGGBBAA` (Depending on the format).

        Params:
            format = Pixel format.
members.name: colors
fill
members.comment:
Fills the entire picture with color.

		Params:
			color = Color fill.

Converting pixels from an array to a color structure.

        Params:
        	bt = Pixel byte array.
        	format = Pixel format.

        Example:
        ---
        import std.algorithm : fill;

        auto bt = new ubyte()[32 * 32 * 4]; // Create virtual image 32x32
        bt.fill(255); // Fill image white color

        image.bytes!ubyte(bt,PixelFormat.RGBA);
        ---
members.name: bytes
setPixel
members.comment:
Set the pixel at the specified location.

        Params:
            x = The x-axis position pixel.
            y = The y-axis position pixel.
            color = Pixel.
members.originalType: @safe void(size_t x, size_t y, Color!ubyte color)

members.name: getPixel
members.comment:
Returns the pixel at the specified location.

        Params:
            x = The x-axis position pixel.
            y = The y-axis position pixel.

members.name: blit
members.comment: Attaches an image to itself at the specified position.

members.name: copy
members.comment:
Redraws the part to a new picture.

		Params:
			x = The x-axis position.
			y = The y-axis position.
			cWidth = Width new picture.
			cHeight = Hight new picture.

members.name: create
members.comment:
Creates a surface with the specified size. Note that it is
        not yet a texture, and you dont need to draw it right away,
        to do this, convert it to a texture.

        Params:
            newWidth = Image width.
            newHeight = Image height.

members.name: load
members.comment:
Loads a surface from a file. Supported formats are described here:
        `https://code.dlang.org/packages/imageformats`

        Params:
            path = Relative or full path to the image file.

members.name: isTexture
members.comment: Whether the picture is a texture.

members.name: fromTexture
members.comment: Convert to a texture for rendering to the window.

members.name: resize
members.comment:
Resizes the image.

        Params:
            newWidth = Image new width.
            newHeight = Image new height.
Clears the specified color component from the picture.
members.name: clearComponent
dup
members.comment: Creates a copy of the picture. Doesn't create a copy of the texture.

members.name: drawEx
members.originalType: void(Renderer renderer, Vecf position, float angle, Vecf center, Vecf size, ubyte alpha)

members.comment: Frees up space for pixels. Does not destroy texture.

members.comment: Frees memory completely from texture and pixels.

name: tida.runtime
comment:
Runtime module. Serves to save some globally significant variables in the library.

    To create a runtime, you just need to call one function for this:
    ---
    TidaRuntime.initialize(args);
    ---

    So it will automatically remember the program arguments and create all the
    conditions for creating a window.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: initialize
members.comment: Creates and initializes a runtime for the program.

members.name: args
members.comment: Returns the arguments that were passed at runtime.

members.comment: Returns a display open in x11 environment.

members.name: xDisplayOpen
members.comment: Opens the display in x11 environment.

members.name: active
members.comment:
Instance activity. If you set this variable to `false`,
            then all events will not be processed, i.e. the object
            will actually be frozen.

members.name: visible
members.comment:
Object visibility. If it is set to `false`, then the
            rendering of the sprite and the` draw` event will not
            be processed.

members.name: persistent
members.comment:
Allows you to move the instance link to another
            scene upon transition. Turns on once.

members.name: solid
members.comment: Maybe the object collides with others

members.comment: Tell the scene to only draw it.

members.name: id
members.comment: The reserved place in the array in the scene.

members.name: threadID
members.comment: Which thread the instance is running on.

members.name: active
members.comment:
Instance activity. If you set this variable to `false`,
            then all events will not be processed, i.e. the object
            will actually be frozen.

members.name: visible
members.comment:
Object visibility. If it is set to `false`, then the
            rendering of the sprite and the` draw` event will not
            be processed.

Allows you to move the instance link to another
            scene upon transition. Turns on once.

Cause the sorting facilities.

        Please note that this action will be performed in the next step.

members.name: destroy
members.comment:
Indicates that it is time to destroy this instance.

        Please note that this action will be performed in the next step.

members.name: add
members.comment:
Adds a component to an instance.

        Params:
            cmp = Component.

Create a component to an instance.

        Params:
            Name = Component.
members.name: add

members.comment:
Returns the component by its class component.

        Params:
            T = Class.

        Example:
        ---
        instance.add!Gravity;
        instance.of!Gravity.F = 0.1f;
        ---
members.name: of

members.comment:
Return the component by its name.

        Params:
            name = Component name.
members.name: of
of
members.comment:
Return the component by its name.

        Params:
            name = Component name.

members.name: init
members.comment:
This event is fired once when control is first transferred
        to the scene. The next time control is transferred, this
        event will not be triggered.
        Note:
            It's useless to use `sceneManager.current` to grab the current
            instance, since this link will enter into the previous scene.
            For real it is better to use `sceneManager.initable`.

members.name: restart
members.comment:
This event will be triggered when control is not transferred
        to the scene for the first time. The first time will not be
        called.
        Note:
            It's useless to use `sceneManager.current` to grab the current
            instance, since this link will enter into the previous scene.
            For real it is better to use `sceneManager.initable`.

members.name: entry
members.comment:
This event is always called when control is transferred to the scene.
        Note:
            It's useless to use `sceneManager.current` to grab the current
            instance, since this link will enter into the previous scene.
            For real it is better to use `sceneManager.initable`.

members.name: event
members.comment:
This event will be triggered when the user enters something.
        This does not mean that it is equivalent to `step`.

members.name: step
members.comment:
This event is called always and constantly at the rate of the specified
        frame counter. Also, when new threads are declared and the instance is
        redefined in a different thread, this event will run on a different thread.

members.name: draw
members.comment:
This event is for drawing something on the screen.
        Params:
            graph = Instance to render.

members.name: drawDebug
members.comment:
This event is intended for rendering in debug mode.
        Params:
            graph = Instance to render.

members.name: gameExit
members.comment:
This event will be triggered when the game is closed by the user or
        the program.

members.name: gameRestart
members.comment: This event will be triggered when the game is restarted by the program.

members.name: gameStart
members.comment: This event will be triggered when the game is launched with `game.run`.

members.name: trigger
members.comment:
This event is fired when someone has thrown a trigger.
        Params:
            oftrigger = Trigger name.

members.name: onError
members.comment: This event will be thrown when any exception is thrown.

members.name: eventDestroy
members.comment: This event will be triggered when the instance is destroyed.

members.name: collision
members.comment: This event will be triggered when this instance collides with someone.

name: tida.scene.manager
comment:
Scene manager module.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: ofbegin
members.comment:
The first added scene.

        It can be overridden so that when the game
        is restarted, the manager will jump to the
        scene from this line:
        ---
        sceneManager.ofbegin = myScene;
        sceneManager.gameRestart();
        ---

members.name: previous
members.comment: The previous scene that was active.

members.name: current
members.comment:
Link to the currently active scene. With the help of it,
        it will be convenient for the instances to communicate
        with the scene.
            For more convenient communication, there
        is a function `getScene`, by which you can access the
        functions of the heir, but the main thing is to check
        the correctness of the scene, otherwise you can get
        an error:
        ---
        sceneManager.current.getScene!HeirScene.callback();
        ---

members.name: initable
members.comment:
Temporary reference during initialization. Use it only
        in the `init`,` restart`, `entry` events. Contains a
        link to the current scene, which will be initialized
        (i.e., control is transferred).

members.name: trigger
members.comment:
Calls a trigger for the current scene, as well as its instances.

        Params:
            name = Trigger name.

members.name: hasScene
members.comment:
Checks if the scene is in the scene list.

        Params:
            scene = Scene.

members.name: add
members.comment:
Adds a scene to the list.

        Params:
            scene = Scene.

Creates and adds a scene to the list.

        Params:
            T = Scene name.

        Example:
        ---
        sceneManager.add!MyScene;
        ---
members.name: add
inbegin
members.comment: Goes to the first scene added.

members.name: gotoin
members.comment:
Goes to the scene by its string name.

        Params:
            name = Scene name.

members.name: gotoin
members.comment:
Goes to the scene by his heir name.

        Params:
            scene = Scene heir.

Scene initialization

Drawing on the surface.

If game restart - call self
        It runs regardless of which scene is active.

Object destruction event. Called then
        when an object requires it to be deleted. The scene will do it
        but you can do something with her before that.
        (how bawdy, yomayo).

name: tida.shape
comment:
This module describes shapes for drawing,
    checking and other things related to the work of shapes.

    Forms are of the following types:
    * `Unknown` - Forms are of the following types:
    * `Point` - Dot. The simplest of the simplest forms. Only origin parameters are valid.
    * `line` - More complex form. Has the origin and the end of the coordinates of its two points.
               By default, this is a line.
    * 'rectangle' - Rectangle shape. By default, such a rectangle is considered to be solid.
    * `circle` - Circle shape. By default, it is considered to be solid.
    * `triangle` - Triangle shape. It is believed to be solid.
    * `multi` - A shape that combines several shapes, which will eventually give a single shape.
        Here you can, for example, create a non-solid polygon:
        ---
        /*
            Such a rectangle can also be created using the function
            `Shape.RectangleLine(begin,end)`.
        */
        auto rectangle_nonSolid = Shape.Multi([
            Shape.Line(Vecf(0,0),Vecf(32,0)),
            Shape.Line(Vecf(32,0),Vecf(32,32)),
            Shape.Line(Vecf(0,0),Vecf(0,32)),
            Shape.Line(Vecf(0,32),Vecf(32,32))
        ], Vecf(0,0));
        ---

    All such types are specified in enum `ShapeType`.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: shapes
members.comment:
A set of figures. Needed for the type when you need
                            to make one shape from several.

Converting a form to another form of its presentation.

        Params:
            T = What to convention?

        Example:
        ---
        Vecf[][] points = myPolygon.to!Vecf[][];
        ---

name: tida.window
comment:
A module for working with windows in a cross-platform environment. A window is created in both Windows and Linux
    environments. OS X and other operating systems are currently not supported due to lack of testing on these
    platforms.

    The window is created primarily not in the constructor, in the constructor the window parameters are initialized
    for its creation. All this is created by the `initialize` method, with an indication of the template parameter,
    which window to create.

    A window can be created either with a ready-made context or without it (i.e., created manually)(Please note that
    the context is strictly created only for the opengl library).

    Creating a simple window is done with a simple `initialize` function:
    ---
    /*
        We just allocate memory for the window, this is not yet the
        stages of its creation.
    */
    Window window = new Window(640,480,"MyTitle");

    /*
        Creates a simple window with no graphics context.
    */
    window.initialize!Simple;
    ---

    There are two ways to create a context:
    1. Initialize the window immediately with the context:
    ---
    window.initialize!ContextIn;
    ---
    2. Create it manually:
    ---
    window.initialize!Simple;

    Context context = new Context();

    /*
        Indicates the attributes of the context.
    */
    context.attrib = GLAttributes(...);
    context.attribInitialize(window);
    context.initialize(window);

    /*
        Sets the context to this window.
    */
    window.contextSet(context);
    ---

    At the moment, windows cannot work in parallel, as well as event tracking and object rendering, so
    you shouldn't even try to create windows in different threads, this will lead to data segmentation.

    It is also recommended to create a window in the recommended way, but if you want to create your
    own render, then immediately put a context in the window so that there are no errors when creating
    a render or manual rendering.

    TODO:
        * Make it possible to create several windows at the same time. Namely, to make `shared` methods for
          working in different threads, both for the window and for the context, event handler and render.

        * Make normal full screen and resize. The fact is that when the size is changed, the render is not
          updated, even if you do a redraw. Apparently, the nodes allocate a buffer.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: Empty
members.comment: Creation of an empty window. Needed for mistakes.

members.name: Simple
members.comment: Creating a simple window, without creating a context in it.

members.name: ContextIn
members.comment: Create a simple window with a context for graphics.

members.name: extensionList
members.comment:
Returns a list of extensions. Because Openg of the second version is used here, it is unlikely that
	it will be useful, but there is also a third version in the plan.

	Returns: `string[]`

members.name: isExtensionSupported
members.comment:
Indicates if the following extension is supported.

	Params:
		name = Extension name.

members.name: Context
members.comment:
An object for describing the context for rendering objects in the opengl library. Able to create a context
    in both Linux and Windows using the glx (for x11) and wgl (for Windows) libraries.

    The contest is also easily set to a window using the window's `contextSet` method:
    ---
    window.contextSet(myContext);
    ---

members.name: attrib
members.comment:
Context creation attributes. It is not necessary to specify them, the attributes
            are already pre-specified.

members.name: this
members.comment:
Initializes a ready-made context.

        Params:
            ctx = GLXContext.
            info = Rendering information: Optional.

members.name: xAttribInitialize
members.comment:
Initializes the context parameters in the x11 environment.

        All parameters are taken from the attrib variable. The default will always be double buffering.

members.name: xContextInitialize
members.comment: Creates a context in the x11 environment.

members.name: attribInitialize
members.comment: Initializes the parameters of the context.

members.name: this
members.comment:
Initialization of window parameters.

        Note:
            * The window will not be created, but the parameters for its creation will be initialized.

        Params:
            newWidth = The width of the window when created.
            newHeight = The height of the window when created.
            newTitle = The title of the window when created.

members.name: this
members.comment:
Initializes the window, assuming the window has an owner.

		Params:
			parent = Owner.
			newWidth = The width of the window when created.
			newHeight = The height of the window when created.
			newTitle = The title of the window when created.
members.originalType: @safe (Window parent, int newWidth, int newHeight, string newTitle)

members.name: initialize
isContext
members.comment:
Finds out if there is a context. Note that the context must be created by the window,
    	or passed to it. If he does not know, but there is such a function, such a function will
    	not work, call the runtime command to find the context.

members.name: initFrom
members.comment:
Initialization of a window using an already created window.

    	Params:
    		window = X11 Window structure.

members.name: xWindowInit
members.comment:
Initializes the window for the context.

        Params:
            posX = The x-axis position.
            posY = The y-axis position.
            visual = Information from context for create window.
            depth = Depth.

members.name: contextSet
members.comment:
Sets an _initialized_ context.

        Params:
            context = Initialized context.

members.name: xContextSet
members.comment: Sets an _initialized_ context of x11 environment.

members.name: xMove

members.comment:
Moves the window to the specified location.

        Params:
            posX = New X-axis position window.
            posY = New Y-axis position window.
members.originalType: @safe void(immutable int posX, immutable int posY)

name: tida.x11
comment:
Module for importing x11 libraries.

    This module is needed, for example, if the way of loading such a
    library is changed, then the code in another project can be left unchanged.

	Authors: TodNaz
	License: MIT
